action.action-desc: Mr. Walz (for himself, Mr. Miller of Florida, Mr. Bilirakis, and Mr. Pascrell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the provision of rehabilitative services for veterans with traumatic brain injury, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans’ Traumatic Brain Injury Rehabilitative Services’ Improvements Act of 2010.

section.header: Rehabilitative services for veterans with traumatic brain injury

subsection.text: Section 1710C of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

clause.text: by inserting , quality of life, after independence;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by inserting rehabilitative services and before rehabilitative components; and

clause.text: by striking treatments the first place it appears and inserting services; and
by striking treatments and the second place it appears; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, and sections 1710D and 1710E of this title, the term rehabilitative services includes—

paragraph.text: rehabilitative services, as defined in section 1701(8) of this title;
services (which may be of ongoing duration) to sustain, and prevent loss of, functional gains that have been achieved; and
any other services or supports that may contribute to maximizing an individual’s independence and quality of life.

subsection.text: Section 1710D(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—
Section 1710E(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting , including rehabilitative services, after medical services.
